sciknow-25x1-scientific-papers.title: Enhancing API Security Testing Against BOLA and Authentication Vulnerabilities Through an LLM-Enhanced Framework
sciknow-25x1-scientific-papers.abstract: This study explores the enhancement of API security testing against Broken Object Level Authorization (BOLA) and Authentication vulnerabilities through the integration of an LLM (Large Language Model)-enhanced framework. By incorporating the OpenHermes 2.5 Mistral 7B model, fine-tuned for domain-specific vulnerabilities, into the Karate testing framework, we demonstrate a novel approach to generating comprehensive and accurate test scenarios. Our methodology emphasizes prompt refinement, dynamic data handling, and endpoint context recognition to address the complexities of API security testing. A case study utilizing the VAmPI API Specification reveals significant improvements in test case generation and complexity, highlighting the potential of fine-tuned LLMs in identifying and mitigating API vulnerabilities. While promising, our exploration uncovers challenges in dataset development, token allocation, and mock data reliance, suggesting areas for future research, including the adoption of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) and Retrieval Aware Fine-Tuning (RAFT) methods. Our findings underscore the transformative impact of LLMs on API security testing, paving the way for more robust and efficient testing frameworks.

sciknow-25x1-methodological-frameworks.name: LLM-Enhanced Framework for API Security Testing
sciknow-25x1-methodological-frameworks.description: The study presents a methodological framework that integrates a fine-tuned Large Language Model (LLM), specifically the OpenHermes 2.5 Mistral 7B model, into the Karate testing framework to enhance API security testing against Broken Object Level Authorization (BOLA) and Authentication vulnerabilities. The methodology emphasizes prompt refinement, dynamic data handling, and endpoint context recognition to generate comprehensive and accurate test scenarios. The framework is evaluated through a case study using the VAmPI API Specification, demonstrating improvements in test case generation and complexity.

studyDesign.designDetails: The study employs a case study design to evaluate the effectiveness of the LLM-enhanced framework in generating test scenarios for API security vulnerabilities. The design does not include a control group or randomization, as it focuses on the application of the framework to a specific API specification and the subsequent analysis of the generated test cases.

procedures.procedureName: Integration and Fine-Tuning of the OpenHermes 2.5 Mistral 7B Model

steps.description: Selection of the Mistral 7B model based on its efficiency, versatility, and innovative features suitable for the framework's requirements.
Curating a custom dataset featuring examples to fine-tune the model for BOLA specifications.
Using Togheter.ai for fine-tuning the model, with customization of hyperparameters and integration with Weights & Biases for training result monitoring.
Compiling a dataset from diverse sources structured around 'question/response' pairs for testing BOLA vulnerabilities.
steps.outputs: Compiled BOLA dataset for Karate testing

steps.description: Training the model and optimizing it based on the reduction in loss and improved predictive accuracy.
Automating the test generation process using the KRTLLM framework, which includes components for data preparation, feature file generation, API framework building, and test running.

procedures.procedureDescription: The procedure involves integrating the OpenHermes 2.5 Mistral 7B model into the KRTLLM framework and fine-tuning it with a custom dataset to target API security vulnerabilities more effectively.

dataAnalysis.summary: The data analysis involves evaluating the effectiveness of the fine-tuned LLM within the Karate DSL-based testing framework by analyzing the generated test cases for their accuracy, complexity, and relevance in targeting BOLA and Authentication vulnerabilities.

resultsRepresentation.summary: The results indicate that the LLM-enhanced framework can generate a significant number of test cases with improved complexity and structure. The framework's ability to recognize endpoint context and handle authentication scenarios was also evaluated, revealing areas for further refinement.
